results.title: The Kakeya problem
results.brief_description:
Features A.S. Besicovitch;
“SUMMARY: discusses the determination of the minimum area within which a line segment may be turned so that its direction is reversed, showing that no such minimum area exists and indicating a process whereby the rotation is performed within an arbitrarily small area”

results.title: The Just, the bad and the ugly
results.creator_credit: Bruce Currie, Currie and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 of Bruce Currie’s dark and surrealistic experimental animations: Flank Breeder (7 mins), Anatomy of a Businessman (7 mins), One Potato Moor (6 mins) and Tar Baby (9 mins). Using the same crew and musicians (Even Orchestra), Currie digresses into dark and pessimistic urban vignettes that are anchored in base emotion: Flank Breeder shows a trapped mailbox living in the city too consumed with his tedious routine to be able to extract himself from his home to save an injured animal outside his door. Anatomy of a Businessman internalises the office politics and disillusionment. One Potato Moor finds a scarecrow (Bruce Currie) lamenting his miserable life whilst fending off a menacing pig (Paul Livingston aka Flacco) in order to survive. Life is really ugly when two men compete bitterly for the attentions of a woman in Tar Baby.

results.title: The Junk playground
results.creator_credit: Sune Lund-Sorensen, Kortfilmradet and Laterna Film
results.brief_description: A playground is an environment forming its occupants through the challenge with which it confronts them and through the chances it gives them to take up these challenges. The documentary is about a couple of junk playgrounds in or near Copenhagen.
results.description: A playground is an environment forming its occupants through the challenge with which it confronts them and through the chances it gives them to take up these challenges. The documentary is about a couple of junk playgrounds in or near Copenhagen.

results.title: The Jungle book (plus special effects production)
results.creator_credit: Zoltan Korda, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy returns to his native village attempting to adapt to human customs and his adopted family. The discovery of a coin in the jungle awakens the greed of the village people who hope to discover a legendary buried treasure. Disillusioned by the greed and violence of humanity he retreats to his loyal and trusted friends … the beasts of the jungle. Stars Sabu. Based on Rudyard Kipling’s “Jungle book”. This version includes special effects techniques and production outtakes.

results.title: The Jungle book
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Raju Patel, Edward S. Feldman and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A faithful adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s classic tale of Moglie the jungle boy who is raised by wolves after being lost when a tiger attacked an encampment and killed his father. Years later he finds himself re-united with his childhood love Kitty and back in the “civilization” of Colonial India which he finds far less civilized then his jungle haunts. The search for a lost treasure shows who the truly civilized members of society are. Cast includes Jason Scott Lee, Cary Elwes, Lena Headey, Sam Neill, John Cleese, Jason Flemyng.

results.title: The Jungle and the plough
results.brief_description: This film shows the work of UNESCO/Ceylon Government Fundamental Education Project at Minneriya in Ceylon. At this centre, men are trained for work in the villages, including the teaching of better farming methods, the stimulation of local industries, health education and adult education. The emphasis in teaching is on a sympathetic approach and pictorial illustration.

results.title: The Juggling movie
results.creator_credit: Patrick Melly and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Shows three jugglers instructing children in the skills of juggling and then performing a comic juggling routine in front of an audience. Features the Pickle Family Jugglers (Larry Pisoni, Peggy Snider, Cecil McKinnon). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Juggler of Notre Dame
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of Anatole France’s story of a juggler named Barnaby who is given shelter in a monastery. To start with, the seemingly worthless Barnaby and his antics displease the monks, but one night his juggling causes a miracle, and the monks realise the worth of Barnaby and his talent. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Joycelin Shrager story
results.creator_credit: Barton Weiss, Mark Block and Kino Delux
results.brief_description: The filmed biography of Joycelin Shrager, a mythical, appallingly incompetent woman director, whose obsession with film pervades her whole existence.

results.title: The Joy of winter
results.creator_credit: Bernard Gosselin, Jean Dansereau, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How Canadians adjust to their long, snowbound season. Filmed with humour, The Joy of Winter shows people making the best of what they cannot change. From tiny tots to human polar bears the film leaves no doubt that, in the eyes of many Canadians, winter may offer more attractions than summer. Film without words. (Awards: Gijon; Necochea.)
